Chapter 2 Tables and Views 2.1 VCS_COMMON_VARAIBLES_MV 2.2 VCS_COST2011 2.3 VCS_COST2012 2.4 VCS_COST2015

Chapter 2 Tables and Views 2.1 VCS_COMMON_VARAIBLES_MV Description: This view presents common variables collected from the cost survey over time. Values are presented at the annual vessel-level for the year in which they were queried unless otherwise noted (nominal dollars). To be considered a common variable, the variable must appear in two or more cost surveys over time. Given that the survey instrument changed over time, there may be slight discrepancies in the variable over time. Please see the comments for further clarification. Data warnings: Crew_Pymts in this year contains both crew and captain payments. Captain_Pymts is null but retained for the cost data application reasons. Yes 2011, 2012, 2015 NA OWNERS_NUM NUMBER(2) Number of owners of the selected vessel Yes 2011, 2012, 2015 NA VESSEL_CONDITION_ACQUIRED VARCHAR2(50) Vessel condition when acquired: New or Acquired from Previous Owner Yes 2011, 2012, 2015 NA HAULOUT CHAR(1) Was the vessel hauled out in the year queried for any reason? (Y/N) Yes 2011, 2012 NA HAULOUT_FREQ VARCHAR2(100) Frequency of haul-out events (every year, every other year, every x years, every xx months). This also includes values from “other” given that they often fit the descriptions listed. Note, if a participant failed to provide the number of years or months, they will render as X or XX. Yes 2011, 2012 NA HAULOUT_COST NUMBER Haul-out costs incurred in the year queried Yes 2011, 2012 NA RMUI_ENGINE_EXP NUMBER Total annual propulsion engine rmui costs for selected vessel Yes 2011, 2012 *RM and UI were asked separately for each sub cost category so they are summed to get a combined RMUI value RMUI_DECK_EQPT_EXP NUMBER Total annual deck equipment and other machinery rmui costs for selected vessel Yes 2011, 2012 *RM and UI were asked separately for each sub cost category so they are summed to get a combined RMUI value RMUI_HULL_EXP NUMBER Total annual hull rmui expenses for selected vessel Yes 2011, 2012 *RM and UI were asked separately for each sub cost category so they are summed to get a combined RMUI value RMUI_GEAR_EXP NUMBER Total annual fishing gear rmui expense cost for selected vessel Yes 2011, 2012 *RM and UI were asked separately for each sub cost category so they are summed to get a combined RMUI value RMUI_ELECTRONICS_EXP NUMBER Total annual wheelhouse electronics rmui cost for selected vessel Yes 2011, 2012 *RM and UI were asked separately for each sub cost category so they are summed to get a combined RMUI value RMUI_PROCESS_REFRIG_EXP NUMBER Total annual processing/refrigeration rmui cost for selected vessel Yes 2011, 2012 *RM and UI were asked separately for each sub cost category so they are summed to get a combined RMUI value RMUI_SAFETY_EQPT_EXP NUMBER Total annual safety equipment rmui cost for selected vessel Yes 2011, 2012 *RM and UI were asked separately for each sub cost category so they are summed to get a combined RMUI value UI_COST NUMBER Total summed upgrade costs (when applicable) Yes 2011, 2012, 2015 2011: individual cost categories provided for propulsion engine, deck equipment/other machinery, hull, fishing gear, wheelhouse and gear electronics, processing/refrigeration, safety equipment; 2012: same format/categories as 2011 plus an “other” category; 2015: asked for one total cost for all categories combine (same categories as 2011); 2022 and on: RM and UI were not asked for separately RM_COST NUMBER Total summed repair and maintenance costs (when applicable, see comment) Yes 2011, 2012, 2015 2011: individual cost categories provided for propulsion engine, deck equipment/other machinery, hull, fishing gear, wheelhouse and gear electronics, processing/refrigeration, safety equipment. Haul-out cost asked separately; 2012: same format/categories as 2011 plus an “other” category; 2015: asked for one total cost for all categories combine (same categories as 2011). Haul-out cost not asked; 2022 and on: RM and UI were not asked for separately. Haul-out cost included as a RMUI variable. RMUI_COST NUMBER Total summed upgrade and improvement and repair and maintenance costs (when applicable, see comment) Yes 2011, 2012, 2015 RM and UI asked separately in 2011, 2012, 2015 but can be summed by adding variables UI_COST and RM_COST. Yes 2011, 2012, 2015 In 2011, 2012 and 2015, this variable includes principal paid on business loans and Interest paid on business loans (apportioned by vessel by dividing by the number of owned vessels for 2012 and 2015). Overhead costs were calculated at the vessel-level for 2012 and 2015 (divided by the number of vessels owned) but apportioned by the respondent in 2015. QUOTA_MONITORING_COST NUMBER(9) Total quota monitoring costs (observer or dockside monitoring costs) for the selected vessel Yes 2011, 2012, 2015 Overhead costs were calculated at the vessel-level for 2012 and 2015 (divided by the number of vessels owned) but apportioned by the respondent in 2011 ADVERTISING_COST NUMBER Total annual advertising costs for the selected vessel Yes 2011, 2012, 2015 Overhead costs were calculated at the vessel-level for 2012 and 2015 (divided by the number of vessels owned) but apportioned by the respondent in 2011 COMMUNICATION_COST NUMBER Total annual communications costs for the selected vessel Yes 2011, 2012 Overhead costs were calculated at the vessel-level for 2012 and 2015 (divided by the number of vessels owned) but apportioned by the respondent in 2011 OFFICE_EXP NUMBER Total annual office/workshop/storage expenses apportioned to the selected vessel Yes 2011, 2012, 2015 SHOP_EXP and OFFICE_EXP variables were combined for survey years 2011 and 2012 to generate this variable for those years. Values are presented at the annual vessel-level for the year in which they were queried unless otherwise noted (nominal dollars). To be considered a common variable, the variable must appear in two or more cost surveys over time. Given that the survey instrument changed over time, there may be slight discrepancies in the variable over time. Please see the comments for further clarification. Data warnings: Crew_Pymts in this year contains both crew and captain payments. Captain_Pymts is null but retained for the cost data application reasons. survey has been scanned and saved to the network drive (1 = YES 0 = NO/NA) Yes NA 2.3 VCS_COST2012 Description: This is the cleaned data collected from the SSB 2012 cost survey. The costs were mostly at the vessel-level, however, some business-level costs which are described in the data warnings section. The data has been cleaned as described in the Cost Survey Tech Memo. All costs are presented in nominal dollars. Data Warnings: All overhead cost variables are collected for all vessels rather than the vessel-level. This includes the following variables: SHOP_EXP , OFFICE_EXP , VEHICLE_USAGE_COST , BUSINESS_TRAVEL_COST, ASSOCIATION_FEES , PROFESSIONAL_FEES, BUS_LOAN_PRINCIPAL_COST, BUS_LOAN_INTEREST_COST, ADVERTISING_COST , and NONCREW_LABOR_COST (#tab:chunck 3)VCS_COST2012 METADATA Variable Name Type Description Notes …5 HULLNUM VARCHAR2(30 BYTE) Official vessel registration number NA NA SURVEY_YEAR NUMBER(4,0) Calendar year for which costs were collected (not the year the survey was administered) NA NA GEAR_TYPE VARCHAR2(40 BYTE) Primary gear type based on majority revenues earned in 2012 NA NA STRATA VARCHAR2(100 BYTE) Survey sampling stratification based on the gear type and vessel length (where “hi avg” and “low avg” indicates above or below the mean length by gear type, respectively) NA NA SURVEY_MODE NUMBER(1,0) Mode for which the survey was completed (0-online response; 1 - mail response) NA NA DISPOSITION VARCHAR2(20 BYTE) Survey completeness (complete, partial) where partial is defined as an individual that answered only a few questions. Complete is defined as an individual that answered more survey questions however, this process was not fully documented, but is retained here for posterity. The costs collected at the vessel or business-level which will be described in the comments section. Note that variable names may change over time such that office_exp could be for all vessels in one year and the selected vessel in another. The data has been cleaned as described in the Cost Survey Tech Memo. All costs are presented in nominal dollars. Data Warnings: All overhead cost variables are collected for all vessels rather than the vessel-level.There may be some variables not included here that are in the survey because there were no responses provided in the dataset.
